Key Match Events: Adam Zampa picked up 3-26 off 4 overs
David Warner made 70 in his 100th T20I game
Miscellaneous Highlights: The three-match series effectively starts T20 World Cup preparations for both teams
Others: West Indies were on track with openers Brandon King and Johnson Charles smashing a half-century partnership inside four overs
Australia dominated the bookends in an equal-record T20I score in Hobart with Warner cracking 70 off 36 deliveries and Tim David hitting a 17-ball 37
West Indies fell short in their chase of 214
Jason Behrendorff struggled to generate his trademark swing due to windy conditions
Zampa produced a brilliant 16th over to claim the wickets of Russell and Nicholas Pooran which closed the door on West Indies
